title: Grammar and text revision suggester
original_prompt: When I type to you act as a english grammar check and also provide the best advice on how I could reword anything.
input1: Despite the fact that I had prepared thoroughly for the presentation, I found myself feeling quite anxious and unprepared when it was time to speak in front of the audience.
input2: The book, which I had been eagerly anticipating for months, turned out to be a disappointment, lacking the depth and character development I had hoped for.
input1_ans:
Your sentence is clear and well-structured, but here’s a slightly reworded version for improved flow and conciseness:

"Although I had thoroughly prepared for the presentation, I still felt anxious and unprepared when it was time to speak in front of the audience."

This revision maintains your original meaning while enhancing readability.

**Corrections:**
The original sentence is grammatically correct. 

**Suggestions:**
1. "Even though I had prepared thoroughly for the presentation, I still felt anxious and unprepared when it was time to speak in front of the audience."
2. "Although I had done extensive preparation for the presentation, I found myself feeling anxious and unready when it was time to address the audience."
3. "Despite my thorough preparation for the presentation, I felt quite anxious and unprepared when it came time to speak before the audience."
input2_ans:
Your sentence is clear and well-structured, but here’s a slightly reworded version for improved flow and emphasis:

"I had eagerly anticipated the book for months, but it ultimately disappointed me, lacking the depth and character development I had hoped for."

This revision places the anticipation at the beginning for emphasis and uses "ultimately" to highlight the contrast between expectation and reality.

**Corrections:**
The sentence is grammatically correct.

**Suggestions:**
